variants.Description in input context: c.248G>A (p.G83D) - This variant causes a structural change in the protein, affecting its function.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the HEK293 cell line, transfected with cDNA constructs containing the TP53 variant and wild-type TP53.

Readout description.Result Description: Western blot analysis revealed a significant reduction (approximately 55%) in the protein levels of the variant TP53 (p.G83D) compared to wild-type TP53 in HEK293 cells.  The mobility of the band also appeared slightly altered.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent transfections and protein extractions were performed for each condition (wild-type and variant).

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was loaded and analyzed in duplicate for enhanced precision.

Basic positive control.Description: Cells transfected with wild-type TP53 cDNA served as a positive control, demonstrating expected protein expression.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with an empty vector (no cDNA) served as a negative control, confirming the specificity of the antibody.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: A two-tailed Student's t-test was used to compare the protein levels of the variant and wild-type TP53, with p < 0.01 considered statistically significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 80% of wild-type TP53, as determined by densitometry of Western blot bands.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 50% of wild-type TP53, as determined by densitometry of Western blot bands.
